16namespace v8 {
17namespace internal {
18
19class Heap;
20class LocalHeap;
21class MainAllocator;
22class PagedNewSpace;
23class PagedSpaceBase;
24class SemiSpaceNewSpace;
25class SpaceWithLinearArea;
26
27class AllocatorPolicy {
28 public:
29 explicit AllocatorPolicy(MainAllocator* allocator);
30 virtual ~AllocatorPolicy() = default;
31
32 // Sets up a linear allocation area that fits the given number of bytes.
33 // Returns false if there is not enough space and the caller has to retry
34 // after collecting garbage.
35 // Writes to `max_aligned_size` the actual number of bytes used for checking
36 // that there is enough space.
37 virtual bool EnsureAllocation(int size_in_bytes,
38 AllocationAlignment alignment,
39 AllocationOrigin origin) = 0;
40 virtual void FreeLinearAllocationArea() = 0;
41
42 virtual bool SupportsExtendingLAB() const { return false; }
43
44 protected:
45 Heap* space_heap() const;
46 Heap* isolate_heap() const;
47
48 MainAllocator* const allocator_;
49};
50
51class SemiSpaceNewSpaceAllocatorPolicy final : public AllocatorPolicy {
52 public:
53 explicit SemiSpaceNewSpaceAllocatorPolicy(SemiSpaceNewSpace* space,
54 MainAllocator* allocator)
55 : AllocatorPolicy(allocator), space_(space) {}
56
57 bool EnsureAllocation(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
58 AllocationOrigin origin) final;
59 void FreeLinearAllocationArea() final;
60
61 private:
62 static constexpr int kLabSizeInGC = 32 * KB;
63
64 void FreeLinearAllocationAreaUnsynchronized();
65
66 SemiSpaceNewSpace* const space_;
67};
68
69class PagedSpaceAllocatorPolicy final : public AllocatorPolicy {
70 public:
71 PagedSpaceAllocatorPolicy(PagedSpaceBase* space, MainAllocator* allocator)
72 : AllocatorPolicy(allocator), space_(space) {}
73
74 bool EnsureAllocation(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
75 AllocationOrigin origin) final;
76 void FreeLinearAllocationArea() final;
77
78 private:
79 bool RefillLab(int size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin);
80
81 // Returns true if allocation may be possible after sweeping.
82 bool ContributeToSweeping(
83 uint32_t max_pages = std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max());
84
85 bool TryAllocationFromFreeList(size_t size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin);
86
87 bool TryExpandAndAllocate(size_t size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin);
88
89 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT bool TryExtendLAB(int size_in_bytes);
90
91 void SetLinearAllocationArea(Address top, Address limit, Address end);
92
93 void FreeLinearAllocationAreaUnsynchronized();
94
95 PagedSpaceBase* const space_;
96
97 friend class PagedNewSpaceAllocatorPolicy;
98};
99
100class PagedNewSpaceAllocatorPolicy final : public AllocatorPolicy {
101 public:
102 PagedNewSpaceAllocatorPolicy(PagedNewSpace* space, MainAllocator* allocator);
103
104 bool EnsureAllocation(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
105 AllocationOrigin origin) final;
106 void FreeLinearAllocationArea() final;
107
108 bool SupportsExtendingLAB() const final { return true; }
109
110 private:
111 bool TryAllocatePage(int size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin);
112 bool WaitForSweepingForAllocation(int size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin);
113
114 PagedNewSpace* const space_;
115 std::unique_ptr<PagedSpaceAllocatorPolicy> paged_space_allocator_policy_;
116};
117
118class LinearAreaOriginalData {
119 public:
120 Address get_original_top_acquire() const {
121 return original_top_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
122 }
123 Address get_original_limit_relaxed() const {
124 return original_limit_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
125 }
126
127 void set_original_top_release(Address top) {
128 original_top_.store(top, std::memory_order_release);
129 }
130 void set_original_limit_relaxed(Address limit) {
131 original_limit_.store(limit, std::memory_order_relaxed);
132 }
133
134 base::SharedMutex* linear_area_lock() { return &linear_area_lock_; }
135
136 private:
137 // The top and the limit at the time of setting the linear allocation area.
138 // These values can be accessed by background tasks. Protected by
139 // pending_allocation_mutex_.
140 std::atomic<Address> original_top_ = 0;
141 std::atomic<Address> original_limit_ = 0;
142
143 // Protects original_top_ and original_limit_.
144 base::SharedMutex linear_area_lock_;
145};
146
147class MainAllocator {
148 public:
149 struct InGCTag {};
150 static constexpr InGCTag kInGC{};
151
152 enum class IsNewGeneration { kNo, kYes };
153
154 // Use this constructor on main/background threads. `allocation_info` can be
155 // used for allocation support in generated code (currently new and old
156 // space).
157 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE MainAllocator(
158 LocalHeap* heap, SpaceWithLinearArea* space,
159 IsNewGeneration is_new_generation,
160 LinearAllocationArea* allocation_info = nullptr);
161
162 // Use this constructor for GC LABs/allocations.
163 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE MainAllocator(Heap* heap, SpaceWithLinearArea* space,
164 InGCTag);
165
166 // Returns the allocation pointer in this space.
167 Address start() const { return allocation_info_->start(); }
168 Address top() const { return allocation_info_->top(); }
169 Address limit() const { return allocation_info_->limit(); }
170
171 // The allocation top address.
172 Address* allocation_top_address() const {
173 return allocation_info_->top_address();
174 }
175
176 // The allocation limit address.
177 Address* allocation_limit_address() const {
178 return allocation_info_->limit_address();
179 }
180
181 Address original_top_acquire() const {
182 return linear_area_original_data().get_original_top_acquire();
183 }
184
185 Address original_limit_relaxed() const {
186 return linear_area_original_data().get_original_limit_relaxed();
187 }
188
189 void MoveOriginalTopForward();
190 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void ResetLab(Address start, Address end,
191 Address extended_end);
192 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool IsPendingAllocation(Address object_address);
193
194 LinearAllocationArea& allocation_info() { return *allocation_info_; }
195
196 const LinearAllocationArea& allocation_info() const {
197 return *allocation_info_;
198 }
199
200 AllocationCounter& allocation_counter() {
201 return allocation_counter_.value();
202 }
203
204 const AllocationCounter& allocation_counter() const {
205 return allocation_counter_.value();
206 }
207
208 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT V8_INLINE AllocationResult
209 AllocateRaw(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
210 AllocationOrigin origin);
211
212 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE AllocationResult
213 AllocateRawForceAlignmentForTesting(int size_in_bytes,
214 AllocationAlignment alignment,
215 AllocationOrigin);
216
217 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void AddAllocationObserver(AllocationObserver* observer);
218 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void RemoveAllocationObserver(AllocationObserver* observer);
219 void PauseAllocationObservers();
220 void ResumeAllocationObservers();
221
222 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void AdvanceAllocationObservers();
223 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void InvokeAllocationObservers(Address soon_object,
224 size_t size_in_bytes,
225 size_t aligned_size_in_bytes,
226 size_t allocation_size);
227
228 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void MakeLinearAllocationAreaIterable();
229
230 void MarkLinearAllocationAreaBlack();
231 void UnmarkLinearAllocationArea();
232
233 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Address AlignTopForTesting(AllocationAlignment alignment,
234 int offset);
235
236 V8_INLINE bool TryFreeLast(Address object_address, int object_size);
237
238 // When allocation observers are active we may use a lower limit to allow the
239 // observers to 'interrupt' earlier than the natural limit. Given a linear
240 // area bounded by [start, end), this function computes the limit to use to
241 // allow proper observation based on existing observers. min_size specifies
242 // the minimum size that the limited area should have.
243 Address ComputeLimit(Address start, Address end, size_t min_size) const;
244
245#if DEBUG
246 void Verify() const;
247#endif // DEBUG
248
249 // Checks whether the LAB is currently in use.
250 V8_INLINE bool IsLabValid() {
251 return allocation_info_->top() != kNullAddress;
252 }
253
254 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void FreeLinearAllocationArea();
255
256 void ExtendLAB(Address limit);
257
258 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool EnsureAllocationForTesting(
259 int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
260 AllocationOrigin origin);
261
262 private:
263 enum class BlackAllocation {
264 kAlwaysEnabled,
265 kAlwaysDisabled,
266 kEnabledOnMarking
267 };
268
269 static constexpr BlackAllocation ComputeBlackAllocation(IsNewGeneration);
270
271 // Allocates an object from the linear allocation area. Assumes that the
272 // linear allocation area is large enough to fit the object.
273 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT V8_INLINE AllocationResult
274 AllocateFastUnaligned(int size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin);
275
276 // Tries to allocate an aligned object from the linear allocation area.
277 // Returns nullptr if the linear allocation area does not fit the object.
278 // Otherwise, returns the object pointer and writes the allocation size
279 // (object size + alignment filler size) to the result_aligned_size_in_bytes.
280 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT V8_INLINE AllocationResult
281 AllocateFastAligned(int size_in_bytes, int* result_aligned_size_in_bytes,
282 AllocationAlignment alignment, AllocationOrigin origin);
283
284 // Slow path of allocation function
285 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE AllocationResult
286 AllocateRawSlow(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
287 AllocationOrigin origin);
288
289 // Allocate the requested number of bytes in the space if possible, return a
290 // failure object if not.
291 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT AllocationResult AllocateRawSlowUnaligned(
292 int size_in_bytes, AllocationOrigin origin = AllocationOrigin::kRuntime);
293
294 // Allocate the requested number of bytes in the space double aligned if
295 // possible, return a failure object if not.
296 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT AllocationResult
297 AllocateRawSlowAligned(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
298 AllocationOrigin origin = AllocationOrigin::kRuntime);
299
300 bool EnsureAllocation(int size_in_bytes, AllocationAlignment alignment,
301 AllocationOrigin origin);
302
303 void MarkLabStartInitialized();
304
305 bool IsBlackAllocationEnabled() const;
306
307 LinearAreaOriginalData& linear_area_original_data() {
308 return linear_area_original_data_.value();
309 }
310
311 const LinearAreaOriginalData& linear_area_original_data() const {
312 return linear_area_original_data_.value();
313 }
314
315 int ObjectAlignment() const;
316
317 AllocationSpace identity() const;
318
319 bool SupportsAllocationObserver() const {
320 return allocation_counter_.has_value();
321 }
322
323 bool SupportsPendingAllocation() const {
324 return linear_area_original_data_.has_value();
325 }
326
327 // Returns true when this LAB is used during GC.
328 bool in_gc() const { return local_heap_ == nullptr; }
329
330 // Returns true when this LAB is used during GC and the space is in the heap
331 // that is currently collected. This is needed because a GC can directly
332 // promote new space objects into shared space (which might not be currently
333 // collected in worker isolates).
334 bool in_gc_for_space() const;
335
336 bool supports_extending_lab() const { return supports_extending_lab_; }
337
338 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool is_main_thread() const;
339
340 LocalHeap* local_heap() const { return local_heap_; }
341
342 // The heap for the current thread (respectively LocalHeap). See comment for
343 // `space_heap()` as well.
344 Heap* isolate_heap() const { return isolate_heap_; }
345
346 // Returns the space's heap. Note that this might differ from `isolate_heap()`
347 // for shared space in worker isolates.
348 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Heap* space_heap() const;
349
350 // The current main or background thread's LocalHeap. nullptr for GC threads.
351 LocalHeap* const local_heap_;
352 Heap* const isolate_heap_;
353 SpaceWithLinearArea* const space_;
354
355 base::Optional<AllocationCounter> allocation_counter_;
356 LinearAllocationArea* const allocation_info_;
357 // This memory is used if no LinearAllocationArea& is passed in as argument.
358 LinearAllocationArea owned_allocation_info_;
359 base::Optional<LinearAreaOriginalData> linear_area_original_data_;
360 std::unique_ptr<AllocatorPolicy> allocator_policy_;
361
362 const bool supports_extending_lab_;
363 const BlackAllocation black_allocation_;
364
365 friend class AllocatorPolicy;
366 friend class PagedSpaceAllocatorPolicy;
367 friend class SemiSpaceNewSpaceAllocatorPolicy;
368};
369
370} // namespace internal
371} // namespace v8

373#endif // V8_HEAP_MAIN_ALLOCATOR_H_
